validation_metadata.verification_method: Direct review of M.G.L. c. 66, § 10 (enhanced 2017 version)

rights_of_access.description: Each agency and municipality must designate a Records Access Officer (RAO) who coordinates responses to public records requests and assists requesters in obtaining records.
rights_of_access.conditions: Mandatory RAO designation; RAO assists requesters; coordinates compliance
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Creates clear accountability point; RAO must help requesters navigate process
rights_of_access.request_tips: Request RAO info: 'M.G.L. c. 66, § 10 requires you to designate a Records Access Officer. Please direct this request to your RAO and provide contact information.'

rights_of_access.description: Records Access Officer must respond within 10 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, or days when office unexpectedly closed). Initial response may include fee estimate for complex requests. Additional 15 business days allowed after payment for record production.
rights_of_access.conditions: 10 business days for response; excludes weekends/holidays/unexpected closures; 15 additional days after payment if needed
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Enhanced 2017 law clarified timelines and fee limitations
rights_of_access.request_tips: Cite deadline: 'M.G.L. c. 66, § 10 requires RAO response within 10 business days. Please respond by [date excluding weekends/holidays].'

rights_of_access.description: Denials must detail specific basis for withholding materials, cite statutory or common law exemptions relied upon, and explain why exemption applies.
rights_of_access.conditions: Must detail specific basis; must cite exemptions; must explain application
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Prevents boilerplate denials; requires agencies to justify with specificity
rights_of_access.request_tips: Challenge inadequate denial: 'M.G.L. c. 66, § 10 requires detailed denial with specific statutory citations and explanation of why exemptions apply. Please provide compliant denial or release records.'

rights_of_access.description: Primary appeal authority for denied requests is Supervisor of Records in Office of Secretary of the Commonwealth. Provides structured administrative review before judicial action.
rights_of_access.conditions: File appeal with Supervisor of Records; administrative review process; judicial review available after
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Specialized oversight through Supervisor of Records; accessible administrative remedy
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert appeal: 'I may appeal this denial to the Supervisor of Records under M.G.L. c. 66, § 10A. Please reconsider to avoid Supervisor involvement.'
